citation.article-title: Nocardia seriolae sp. nov. causing nocardiosis of cultured fish

p.s: Description of Nocardia seriolae sp. nov.
Nocardia seriolae (se. ri. o' lae. L. gen. n. seriolae named after the genus of the yellowtail, S. quinqueradiata)
Branching vegetative mycelia which break up into nonmotile rodlike elements are formed.
Macroscopic aerial mycelia are not found.
The color of colonies on yeast extract-malt extract agar (ISP medium no. 2) is yellowish orange.
Adenine, casein, hypoxanthine, tyrosine, and xanthine are not decomposed.
Acid is produced from glucose and glycerol, but not from adonitol, arabinose, erythritol, galactose, inositol, maltose, mannitol, rhamnose, sorbitol, and xylose.
Citrate and succinate are utilized as carbon sources, but benzoate, mucate, and tartrate are not.
Cysteine is utilized as a nitrogen source, but NaNO3, (NH4)2HPO4, acetamide, pyrazinamide, urea, L-glutamate, L-phenylalanine, and L-serine are not.
Grows in lysozyme broth, but not in rifampin broth.
Does not require and is not resistant to sodium chloride.
Growth temperature ranges from 15 to 30°C; does not grow above 35°C.
Does not survive at 50°C for 8 h.
The G+C content of the DNA is 66.8 to 67.4 mol%.
The type strain is strain JCM 3360.
This organism is a pathogen of cultured fish.
